entry.title: Step Into the Future: SAP Business AI Operations Certification for Partners

entry.title: From ABAP to the World: Daniel‚Äôs Journey of Growth and Resilience
entry.content:
If you meet Daniel Mateo Perez outside work, you'll likely find him by the ocean. On Saturday mornings, he's barefoot on the beach with tea or planning his next trip‚Äîhe's visited over 60 countries. Travel shapes his curious, adaptable, and open perspective‚Äîtraits vital for SAP projects.

Daniel didn‚Äôt plan a career working with SAP technology. A Chemical Engineering graduate in Barcelona, he began his professional journey as an ABAP developer at a consulting firm. But he quickly realized his real passion was in connecting technology with business. A manager advised him: ‚ÄúIf you really want to grow, learn Finance and Logistics with SAP.‚Äù That moment changed everything.

His first SAP classroom training in Supply Chain Management sparked a powerful realization. ‚ÄúFor the first time, I saw how procurement, inventory, and finance all connected. It blew my mind‚Äîthis was the solution that runs companies.‚Äù That moment didn‚Äôt just build knowledge; it gave him a surge of confidence and set a clear direction for his professional journey.

Two decades later, SAP certifications have propelled his career and unlocked new opportunities. Today, he proudly holds SAP Activate Project Manager and SAP S/4HANA for Financial Accounting certifications and is already reaching higher, working toward more in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Each one, Daniel says, has been ‚Äúa credibility booster,‚Äù fueling his ongoing professional growth.

‚ÄúSAP Certifications gave me more than technical skills,‚Äù he explains. ‚ÄúThey gave me trust. With clients, with colleagues, and with myself. When you‚Äôre certified, people know you can deliver.‚Äù

That trust opened doors. Daniel has led multi-country SAP S/4HANA rollouts across various industries, including pharmaceuticals and media, co-authored a book on rollout strategies in Spanish, and mentored younger consultants as they navigate their careers. He‚Äôs also become known as the calm presence during stressful go-lives‚Äîsomeone who can translate between IT and finance and keep projects moving.

It hasn‚Äôt always been easy. Switching from development to finance consulting nearly made him quit. ‚ÄúI remember leaving a workshop convinced I‚Äôd never understand finance,‚Äù he admits. But curiosity‚Äîand the structure of SAP learning materials‚Äîkept him going. Step by step, SAP Certification by SAP Certification, he built both expertise and resilience.

Looking back, he says the biggest surprise is that SAP learning never ends. ‚ÄúAt first it felt overwhelming, but now I see it as the reason my career has stayed exciting.‚Äù

If he could give advice to his younger self‚Äîor anyone considering starting‚ÄîDaniel would keep it simple: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt wait until you feel ready. Nobody knows everything. Just start, get certified, and grow from there.‚Äù

From backpacking buses in Asia, where he studied for certifications, to global boardrooms where he delivers enterprise transformations, Daniel‚Äôs story showcases the real power of SAP Certification: it doesn‚Äôt just unlock opportunities‚Äîit gives you the confidence and credibility to walk through them.

Take your next step: visit the SAP Learning site, choose your certification, and start shaping your future today.

entry.title: One Hour, One Habit, One Champion: Kunal Bansal‚Äôs Lifelong Learning Story üèÜ
entry.content:
Ask Kunal Bansal what the most powerful skill in his career has been, and he won‚Äôt say coding, consulting, or communication - he‚Äôll say consistency. Every single day, no matter where he is, he dedicates one hour to learning. That one habit has not only shaped his expertise but also inspired hundreds of others to start their own learning journeys. 

Q: Paint us a picture of who you are beyond work. What would we find you doing on a Saturday morning? What‚Äôs something about you that might surprise your colleagues? 

Saturday mornings start with badminton with friends and afternoons mentoring rural students. Supporting underprivileged learners keeps me grounded and reminds me why learning matters. 

I spend at least an hour daily learning. It‚Äôs as natural as breathing, but far more rewarding. Mentoring isn‚Äôt just a hobby; it‚Äôs my passion. Networking and talking to people across industries taught me business processes, the foundation that made SAP technology click for me. 

Q: Take us inside a typical business day. What makes you excited to get up in the morning, and what frustrates you? 

My day begins with a workout at the gym. My favorite and happiest hour. After that come leadership calls on people and skill management for our SAP CX practice, followed by client project calls. 

Tea, lunch, and walks with colleagues mix jokes, work talk, and wisdom. 
What frustrates me? Seeing colleagues stuck in a non-learning, non-growth mindset. 
What excites me? Helping them flip the switch and grow. 

Q: Tell us about the moment you decided to learn SAP. What sparked that decision? 

I started my career in the SAP Student Training and Rotation program - clueless, wide-eyed, and wondering how to survive in this massive ocean. My mentor, Ramakrishna, told me something that shaped my entire journey: ‚ÄúStart with basics and learn business processes, not systems.‚Äù 

Q: What was your biggest ‚Äòaha!‚Äô moment? 

Back in 2016, I was working on SAP CRM and SAP Marketing Cloud. When I finally understood the CRM business process, the dots connected. 

I realized that technology wasn‚Äôt just moving data. It was orchestrating the heartbeat of a business. That shift turned me into a trusted advisor to customers and the go-to person for technical and business challenges. 

Q: What was the hardest part of your learning journey? 

Opening SAP Learning Hub for the first time felt like entering a massive library without a map - overwhelming! 

I remembered my mentor‚Äôs advice: start from basics, learn business processes first. Once I did, the chaos turned into clarity. That persistent learning turned me from a rookie into a recognized community voice. 

Q: What surprised you most about the learning process? 

Answering Q&A and writing blogs on SAP Community accelerated my learning more than I expected. 

Contributing consistently for over seven years helped me become a community influencer and built my personal brand as a subject matter expert which eventually led to my selection as an SAP Champion.  

Q: What‚Äôs something you can do now that you couldn‚Äôt before? 

Previously, I used to explain SAP technology in dense technical jargon, regardless of the audience. Now, I adapt my speech according to the target audience as below:
  • Developers: features, APIs, and architecture 
  • Consultants: flows, modules, and configuration 
  • Executives: business impact and how the Intelligent Enterprise helps companies run smarter 

This shift makes me more effective in stakeholder discussions, project planning, and skill development. 

Q: Looking back, what advice would you give your younger self or someone just starting their SAP journey? 

To my younger self, I‚Äôd say: ‚ÄúStart with basics, business processes, then explore SAP modules.‚Äù 

To newcomers: first understand real-world business challenges and processes, then learn Intelligent Enterprise concepts and SAP Business Suite flows. Everything else falls into place. 

Q: How has your learning impacted others at work or beyond? 

My journey has inspired juniors, peers, and even seniors to seek guidance for their SAP learning. 

Outside work, this led to invitations to podcasts, panels, and SAP events as a speaker. It also strengthened my credibility and reinforced my position as a thought leader in the SAP ecosystem. 

At this point, friends and colleagues joke: ‚ÄúJust Google his name, you‚Äôll find him.‚Äù 

Q: What‚Äôs been your proudest moment? 

Being recognized as one of SAP Champions worldwide was surreal and humbling. But I‚Äôm equally proud of helping colleagues grow, guiding careers, and creating a culture of continuous learning within my practice. 

Q: Bonus question: what‚Äôs the weirdest place you‚Äôve ever studied SAP? 

Definitely old bookshops on Bangalore‚Äôs streets, while hunting for novels. They gave me strange looks but for me, learning can happen anywhere. 

Q: And if your SAP learning journey were a movie? 

‚ÄúLearning Is Lifelong.‚Äù The moment you think you‚Äôve mastered it all, the technology changes and you realize you‚Äôre still a student. 

Kunal‚Äôs advice to every SAP learner: 

‚ÄúStart with what businesses need, not what buttons to click. SAP understanding, certifications and success will follow.‚Äù 

Ready to carve out your own daily hour? Explore learning journeys and certifications on the SAP Learning site  and see how far curiosity can take you.

entry.title: SAP Supply Chain Management Certification: Increase Your Expertise and Credibility
entry.content:
Running sustainable, resilient supply chains amid disruptions has become a driving force in many organizations. While supply chains have historically prioritized efficiency and cost reduction, digital technologies are delivering incredible gains to achieve even greater outcomes, while connecting processes and enabling faster insights.

In these times of rapid innovation, it‚Äôs becoming increasingly more critical to stay informed of the latest positioning guidance for SAP Supply Chain solutions. SAP has addressed this need by offering a non-technical certification option: Positioning SAP Business Suite via SAP Supply Chain Management Solutions. The non-technical certifications options are designed to be completed in a matter of few hours, thus making it a great option for individuals who are new to certification, looking to replace an expired certification, or simply interested in cultivating expertise in selling SAP Supply Chain solutions. 

Becoming certified in SAP Supply Chain Management solutions will prepare you to gain the confidence and trust in your biggest stakeholder, the Chief Operating Officer (‚ÄúCOO‚Äù).

  • How AI is being used today in modern business settings as well as how it fits into the SAP‚Äôs Business AI strategy.

    • Articulating the value of SAP Supply Chain solutions through an executive pitch

  • Successful completion of a one-hour exam that will include thirty questions derived from the self-paced learning content.

Don‚Äôt Delay‚Äîtake advantage of this opportunity to establish your credibility in SAP Supply Chain Management and showcase your accomplishment. With around 5 hours of self-paced learning, this certification option is achievable for any busy professional and will provide tangible value in your field of expertise. Visit the SAP Learning Site to review the available certifications and select Positioning SAP Business Suite via SAP Supply Chain Management so you can start expertly positioning SAP‚Äôs Supply Chain Management solutions to solve your customer‚Äôs key challenges and deliver real-world results.

entry.title: Learning with Heart and Structure: Patrizia Rossi‚Äôs Story
entry.content:
In 2020, Patrizia Rossi welcomed a tiny puppy into her life in Rome. ‚ÄúHe was so small and tender that just looking at him made me feel better,‚Äù she recalls. What began as playful walks and teaching simple commands soon grew into something more substantial. By combining instinct with structured training, Patrizia discovered a whole new world. In time, she and her dog even became agility champions, something she never imagined at the beginning.

Patrizia and her puppy trainingThat joyful chapter came during a challenging time, after the loss of her younger brother and her mother. The puppy became more than a companion. He was a source of comfort and a reminder that growth often comes from pairing passion with structure.

For Patrizia, the parallel with her SAP-related career was clear. Twenty years earlier, she began her career as an ABAP developer in Turin, learning by doing. Over the years, she specialized in SAP Fiori and SAP Business Technology Platform. Like with her dog, instinct and practice alone weren‚Äôt enough for her full potential.

‚ÄúTo really grow, I needed structured learning, a path that combined hands-on experience with theory,‚Äù she explains.

That approach shaped her career. Until 2024, Patrizia was an SAP consultant, supporting clients on backend and frontend solutions. Recently, she joined the European Space Agency as an SAP Solution Architect. Her role now demands concrete, reliable solutions, and SAP Certifications give her that foundation.

She recently earned the  SAP BTP Solution Architect certification, adding to several certifications. For her, certifications aren‚Äôt just credentials; they build confidence. "When you know the theory, you don‚Äôt just work better, you become an added value. You support colleagues, propose stronger solutions, and solve problems faster."

That difference was clear when she activated SAP Build Work Zone Advanced Edition. Since she was also preparing for the SAP Build Work Zone certification, she was able to solve issues quickly that practicing alone wouldn‚Äôt have prepared her for.

‚ÄúThose are the moments when you feel like you‚Äôve won the lottery,‚Äù she laughs. ‚ÄúAfter banging your head against a problem, you run a test and‚Ä¶ it works!‚Äù

Patrizia remembers a colleague who encouraged her. Every time she cracked a tough problem, he would laugh and shout: "MONSTER!" Though he is no longer here, Patrizia keeps the tradition. "Whenever I solve something impossible, I still whisper: ‚ÄòMONSTERRR!‚Äô"

For Patrizia, certifications and structured learning turned her from a consultant who once relied on instinct to a solution architect trusted at the highest levels. Just like in dog training, practice matters‚Äîbut theory and structure make you unstoppable.

Want to become the next ‚Äúmonster‚Äù problem solver? Explore structured learning paths and certifications at the SAP Learning site.

entry.title: Strengthening Security on SAP BTP Neo Environment with DigiCert Global Root G3
entry.content:
At SAP, keeping your data and applications secure is always a top priority.
To further strengthen the security of the SAP BTP Neo environment, we are migrating to the ‚ÄúDigiCert Global Root G3‚Äù Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). This update ensures long-term trust, improved encryption, and compliance with the latest international security standards.

Do You Need to Do Anything

For most customers, no action is required.
Modern web browsers (like Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox) and up-to-date operating systems already trust the new DigiCert Global Root G3 certificate automatically.

However, if your organization manages certificates manually or maintains its own trust store, your technical team should add the new G3 certificate before the March 2026 deadline.
This ensures continued, secure access to SAP BTP services.

Important: Do not remove the existing G2 certificate ‚Äî both should remain active during the transition.

Why This Matters

This change is part of SAP‚Äôs ongoing commitment to:

  • Keep your data and applications secure
  • Align with the latest global and national security standards
  • Ensure continued compatibility with modern browsers and systems

By making this upgrade, SAP is helping customers stay protected and ready for the future.

Timeline

The full migration to DigiCert Global Root G3 will take effect in March 2026.

Until then, both the G2 and G3 certificates will remain active to ensure a smooth transition.

How to Add the DigiCert Global Root G3 Certificate

If you manage your own trust stores, please follow these steps:

  1. Visit the DigiCert root certificate page: https://www.digicert.com/kb/digicert-root-certificates.htm
  2. Locate ‚ÄúDigiCert Global Root G3.‚Äù
  3. Download the appropriate certificate format for your environment.
  4. Verify the certificate fingerprint using your preferred tool (for example, with OpenSSL:
    openssl x509 -noout -text -in ./DigiCertGlobalRootG3.crt.pem -fingerprint)
  5. Follow your trust store‚Äôs instructions to add the certificate.

For guidance on managing trusted certificates for SAP BTP, see the BTP Trust Store on GitHub. To streamline future updates, we recommend applying the BTP Trust Store regularly or automating this process.

Affected Domains

This update applies to the following platform domains in the SAP BTP Neo environment:

*.<Region.Domain> 

*.dispatcher.<Region.Domain> 

*.cert.<Region.Domain> 

*.static.<Region.Domain> 

*.vms.<Region.Domain> 

*.netweaver.ondemand.com 

connectivitynotification.<Region.Domain> 

connectivitytunnel.<Region.Domain>

For a full overview of regions and domain hosts, see the SAP Help Portal.

Custom Domains

SAP-owned custom domains are not affected by this change until March 2026.
After this date, all new automated certificate renewals will use the DigiCert Global Root G3 certificate. New SAP-owned custom domains created after March 2026 will also use G3 by default.


Staying secure is a shared effort ‚Äî and we‚Äôre making it easier for you.
With the DigiCert Global Root G3 upgrade, SAP BTP continues to offer a trusted, reliable, and compliant cloud environment for your business.

entry.title: Preparing for SAP C_CPE? Here‚Äôs How I‚Äôm Studying Each Section Without Feeling Overwhelmed
entry.content:
Whenever I start learning something new, I like to have everything in order.
Before I even open the first tutorial, I plan what I‚Äôll study first, what comes next, and how I‚Äôll track it.

Recently, I started preparing for the SAP C_CPE (SAP Certified Associate - Backend Developer - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model) certification. Since this exam covers a mix of BTP architecture, SAP BAS, CAP, Side by side extensions, Cloud Foundry & Kyma Runtime  it can easily feel like too much at once. So I created a simple structure to move step by step without feeling lost.

I began with the learning about BTP, and doing hands on by following SAP Learning Journeys, creating subaccount and adding entitlements and services (It gave me a very clear understanding of BTP architecture) and then Developing appliaction using high productivity tools of SAP BAS, Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) because it‚Äôs the foundation of most topics in this certification. I‚Äôm spending around two weeks learning about CDS models, service layers and how everything connects in a CAP project. I‚Äôm following the official SAP Learning Journey https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-backend-developer-sap-cloud-program‚Ä¶...

My next focus is Cloud Foundry. I‚Äôll spend about a week learning how to efficiently develop, run, and manage cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime.

After that, I‚Äôll move to Side by side extention on BTP.  This will cover deploying  extension and integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone.

The next stage is Developing Appliactions in Kyma Environment. I‚Äôll take about two weeks to explore a comprehensive understanding of Kubernetes and to orchestrate the deployment of the applications in the cloud. 

Finally, I‚Äôll study Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK for about two more weeks. These are slightly advanced topics but very useful for understanding to develop and integrate Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript extension applications for SAP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

So in short, this will be my roadmap-

Recommended Study Sequence

Here‚Äôs the order I suggest, from foundational to more advanced :

1.Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform 5hrs (link : https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-business-technology-platform)

  • This gives you a broad overview of the entire platform (services, architecture, what BTP is). Good for building your base understanding.
  • So start here.

2.Develop Full‚ÄëStack Applications Using Productivity Tools in SAP Business Application Studio 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-full-stack-applications-using-productivity-tools-in-sap-business-application-studio)

3.Develop Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime 4hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-on-sap-btp-cloud-foundry-runtime)

  • The Cloud Foundry runtime is a major runtime environment in BTP. Understanding how to build and deploy there is critical. 

4.Build Side‚Äëby‚ÄëSide Extensions on SAP BTP 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/build-side-by-side-extensions-on-sap-btp)

  • After tooling and platform basics, you dive into extension scenarios (for example side-by-side extensions of S/4HANA using CAP). This aligns closely with CAP certification topics.

5.Developing Applications in SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime 8hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-in-sap-btp-kyma-runtime)

  • Kyma Runtime is more advanced (Kubernetes, microservices, event-mesh) and often sits on top of foundational knowledge. 

6.Develop Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK 11hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-advanced-extensions-with-sap-cloud-sdk)

This is relatively specialized/advanced (SAP Cloud SDK, perhaps custom libraries, integrations). Once you‚Äôve mastered the fundamentals above, you go here.

By the end of this plan, I‚Äôll go through a short revision period with mock questions and quick notes from my learning.

This structured approach keeps my study plan clear and prevents me from feeling overwhelmed.
I study for two to four hours a day which feels realistic, and the small milestones make it easier to stay consistent.

If you‚Äôre also preparing for C_CPE, it really helps to make your own sequence instead of jumping randomly between topics. The Learning Journeys are excellent resources, but having a personal roadmap makes a big difference.

I‚Äôd love to hear how others are preparing for this certification too.

entry.title: Reimagining Certification for the Way We Work Today
entry.content:
For decades, certifications exams have followed the same pattern: silent rooms, strict proctors, and no access to the tools you‚Äôd normally use to get work done. The goal was to test what you knew (or could remember) in that moment, not what you could actually do. But work doesn‚Äôt happen that way. And learning certainly doesn‚Äôt either. 

Today, projects are fast paced, connected, and collaborative. When you‚Äôre solving a problem, you don‚Äôt sit in silence ‚Äî you look for information, consult with teammates, and use the tools available to you. With AI now woven into how we all work, it‚Äôs time for certification to evolve too. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre reimagining SAP Certification. 

From memory to mastery 

SAP Certification is shifting from proctored, multiple-choice tests to performance-based, practical, open-book assessments that mirror real work. 

Instead of answering theoretical questions, you‚Äôll complete realistic challenges that show how you actually apply your SAP knowledge ‚Äî configuring systems, building applications, solving problems, or advising customers on solutions. 

There are two types of practical exams: 

  • System-based: You‚Äôll perform time-boxed tasks directly in SAP systems. 
  • Scenario-based: You‚Äôll interact with an AI avatar to respond to real customer or project situations. (For learners who don‚Äôt want to use AI, we provide an alternative option to upload a video for human review.) 

These ‚Äòopen-book‚Äô exams allow access to resources like SAP Help Portal, SAP Learning site, SAP Community, or SAP Joule for Consultants ‚Äî just as you would use in your daily work. 

Learning that feels real 

This transformation makes certification more meaningful and consistent with how you already learn. The types of practical exercises and scenarios you complete on the SAP Learning site now continue into the exam, so preparation and assessment feel like part of one experience. 

Each exam is time-boxed and focused on proving you can do the work, not just recall facts. There‚Äôs no live proctoring; instead, identity is confirmed through SAP Universal ID, reflecting trust in how professionals really work. You‚Äôll still have to think critically and manage your time, but you‚Äôll do so in a context that mirrors your day-to-day work, not an artificial testing environment. 

A phased rollout for all certifications 

Beginning in November 2025, the first practical certifications, including Solution Architect for SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Generative AI Developer, SAP Build Developer, SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP BTP System Administrator (new) and RISE with SAP Methodology and Experience (new,) will go live.

entry.title: How to Prepare for SAP‚Äôs New Certification
entry.content:
For years, SAP certification relied on multiple-choice questions and memorized answers. That approach no longer fits the realities of modern SAP work, where professionals configure systems, solve business problems, and increasingly collaborate with AI-driven tools. Simply recalling information isn‚Äôt enough.

The new SAP certification model shifts the focus from ‚Äúknowing SAP‚Äù to ‚Äúdoing SAP,‚Äù i.e., applying skills in real-world scenarios, navigating tools, and demonstrating practical competence.

If you‚Äôre planning to get certified soon, your preparation needs to evolve with it.

What‚Äôs Changing and What It Means for Your Preparation

SAP‚Äôs new practical certification exams introduce a more authentic and performance-oriented approach to skill validation. Instead of testing whether you can recall a configuration detail, the new exams examine whether you can complete tasks, solve problems, and make decisions in situations that resemble real project environments.

They use two primary formats: System-based assessment and Scenario-based assessment.

The System-based assessment is where learners work inside a time-limited SAP system simulation. You are required to perform actual tasks, such as configuring components, building processes, developing artifacts, or resolving issues, just as you would in a project environment. The assessment measures your fluency in SAP tools, your ability to execute steps accurately, and your ability to apply best practices in a live system.

The Scenario-based assessment places you in time-limited role-play situations with an AI avatar. In these scenarios, you must pitch SAP solutions, advise on architecture, justify design choices, respond to stakeholder concerns, and guide the conversation toward appropriate outcomes. Rather than executing system tasks, this format evaluates how you think, communicate, analyse requirements, and represent SAP‚Äôs capabilities in a business context.

Each certification will use only one format, either system-based or scenario-based, depending on the nature of the role being assessed. Technical roles emphasise hands-on execution, while consulting and architecture roles prioritise analytical and advisory depth. This creates a more precise and meaningful measurement of job readiness.

The exams are also now open-book, allowing access to documentation, help portals, and AI-assisted guidance during the assessment. This change reflects how professionals actually work. They consult resources, verify information, test assumptions, and use intelligent tools like SAP Joule to support decision-making. The exam rewards the ability to locate, interpret, and apply information under realistic constraints.

SAP is rolling out this new model in phases. The first six certifications are already live and have received a strong response from the ecosystem.

Click this link to access the SAP Certifications featuring practical exams.

How to Prepare for SAP's New Certification

Train on SAP Systems

Hands-on experience is now the most important part of certification readiness. Since the new exams rely heavily on real system usage or scenario execution, you must become comfortable navigating SAP environments directly. Spend time configuring components, building workflows, testing integrations, and troubleshooting issues in SAP BTP,  SAP Build, and other relevant tools.

Memorizing theory will not substitute for actual system familiarity, so create consistent practice sessions that mirror the tasks you expect to face in real projects.

Adopt an Open-Book Learning Mindset

Because SAP‚Äôs new exams allow access to documentation and official resources, your success depends on how efficiently you can locate and apply information. Instead of trying to memorize every detail, shift your focus toward learning how SAP documentation is structured, where key topics are located, and how to interpret guidance quickly under time constraints.

During preparation, challenge yourself to answer questions by navigating documentation rather than recalling facts.

Practise Scenario-Based Problem Solving

The new certification format rewards professionals who can think in end-to-end scenarios rather than isolated tasks. To build this skill, spend time working through full business situations that could appear in an exam.

Imagine a client wants to automate approval workflows, integrate an external application, or modernize their analytics landscape. Break down how you would approach the requirement, which SAP tools you would use, what architecture makes sense, and what risks or trade-offs you would consider.

The more you practise this style of thinking, the more natural it becomes to articulate decisions and explain your reasoning during a scenario-based assessment.

Strengthen Your Architecture and Data Foundations

Modern SAP work revolves around cloud services, data modeling, integration patterns, event-driven design, and automation. To prepare for the new certifications, make time to revisit these fundamentals. Understanding how components fit together will help you make informed decisions, whether you are configuring a system or advising a simulated stakeholder. This broader technical foundation also enables you to respond effectively during role-plays that require architectural justification or strategic recommendations.

Build a Continuous Learning Habit

The redesigned certification model encourages professionals to keep their skills active rather than rely on one-time exam success. As SAP continues to evolve its tools and expand its AI-driven capabilities, staying connected to the ecosystem, whether through hands-on practice, learning content, or experimentation with new features, will help you remain prepared for renewals and future certifications.

What These Changes Mean for Your Career

The new certification format narrows the gap between being certified and being project-ready.

As the assessments test actual capability, credentials earned under this model will carry greater weight with employers seeking professionals who can contribute immediately. It also shifts the ecosystem toward continuous learning, where staying certified means staying active, hands-on, and connected to SAP‚Äôs evolving technologies.

The certifications also mark an important milestone in SAP‚Äôs broader commitment to equip 12 million people worldwide with AI-ready skills by 2030.

If you approach your learning with the mindset of becoming truly project-ready rather than simply exam-ready, you will not only succeed in the new certification format but also build a stronger, more sustainable foundation for your SAP career.

The exam has evolved, and your preparation needs to evolve with it, too.

entry.title: SAP Certification Is Changing: What You Need to Know About the New Format
entry.content:
If you‚Äôve been following SAP‚Äôs certification updates, you‚Äôll know things are changing in a big way. The traditional multiple-choice exams are being replaced with a much more practical approach. I recently went through all the latest materials and sessions about the new SAP certification format, especially for SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), and I want to share what I learned and how you can prepare.

Why Is SAP Changing Its Certification Format?

SAP wants certifications to mean more than just passing a test. The new format is designed to make sure certified professionals can actually do the work required on real SAP projects. Instead of just memorizing theory, you‚Äôll be asked to solve problems and perform tasks that you‚Äôd encounter in your day-to-day job. This shift is great news for both candidates and employers. Companies can trust that certified consultants are ready for hands-on work, and candidates can show they‚Äôre truly job-ready.

What‚Äôs Different About the New Exams?

The biggest change is the move to performance-based assessments. You‚Äôll be asked to complete tasks in a simulated SAP system, or respond to real-world scenarios, sometimes interacting with an AI avatar or submitting a video response. You can use SAP Help Portal, SAP Learning, and even SAP Joule (the AI tool) during the exam, just like you would on a real project. This open-book style makes the exam feel much more like actual work.

You also get to choose how you want to be assessed for some parts: either through an AI role-play or by uploading a video. After you finish, you‚Äôll receive instant feedback, including analytics on your technical depth and communication skills.

Role-Based Certifications and Staying Certified

SAP certifications are now tailored to specific job roles, such as developer, administrator, or architect. This means the exam content is more relevant to what you‚Äôll actually do in your role. Certifications aren‚Äôt permanent anymore. You‚Äôll need to complete a ‚Äústay-certified‚Äù assessment each year to keep your credential active. This helps ensure everyone stays up to date with the latest SAP technology and best practices.

Timeline for the New Format

The rollout starts in November 2025 for selected exams, including SAP BTP Administrator, SAP Build Developer, Solution Architect ‚Äì SAP BTP, SAP Business Data Cloud, and SAP Generative AI Developer. By 2026, all SAP certifications will use this new practical format.

What Hasn‚Äôt Changed?

You‚Äôll still get a digital badge when you pass, and the registration process is the same as before. If you already have a certification, it remains valid, but you‚Äôll need to follow the renewal process to keep it active.

How Should You Prepare?

Focus on building practical SAP skills. Spend time working in SAP simulation environments, and practice explaining SAP solutions clearly and simply. Get comfortable with timed tasks and AI evaluation, and make sure your laptop, internet, webcam, and audio all meet SAP‚Äôs technical requirements before exam day.

Spotlight on SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) Certification

The BDC certification is a great example of the new approach. It covers foundational knowledge and practical skills in SAP Business Data Cloud. The assessment includes technical knowledge of BDC, integration with SAP Business Warehouse, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Databricks. To earn the badge, you‚Äôll need to complete the recommended SAP Learning Journey and pass the C_BCBDC exam. Remember to renew your badge every year.

Exam questions breakdown from my attempt:

 

  • Technical Knowledge of BDC (40%)
  • Integration with SAP Business Warehouse (15%)
  • Technical Knowledge of SAP Analytics Cloud (15%)
  • Technical Knowledge of SAP Datasphere (15%)
  • Technical Knowledge of SAP Databricks (15%)

 

Tips for Success

Take your time and use the pause button to think before you answer. Break your responses into clear chunks, and don‚Äôt worry about giving too much information, there‚Äôs no penalty for being thorough. Read the feedback you get and use it to improve before your next attempt. And don‚Äôt rush; you have plenty of time.

Useful Links

Here are some resources that helped me:

  • SAP Certification Overview
  • SAP Certification in the Age of AI
  • SAP BDC Learning Journey
  • SAP Certification BDC

Final Thoughts

SAP‚Äôs new certification format is a big step forward. It‚Äôs designed to make sure credentials really mean something and that certified professionals are ready for real project work. If you‚Äôre preparing for the SAP Business Data Cloud certification, focus on practical skills, clear communication, and continuous learning. The future of SAP certification is here, and it‚Äôs all about being ready for the real world.

If you have questions or want to share your experience with the new SAP certification, I‚Äôd love to hear from you in the comments.

entry.title: My Experience with the New SAP Exam Format¬†(2026)
entry.content:
Starting from November 2025, SAP officially introduced a significant change to its certification journey: an open-book, scenario-based exam format. This new approach is currently in pilot for selected certifications, including the SAP BTP Solution Architect exam.

Details about format here: Reimagining certification in the age of AI

Last week, I had the chance to take this new exam for the certificate ‚ÄúSAP BTP Solution Architect‚Äù and I want to share my honest experience, especially for those preparing for it soon.

After reading the new update from SAP (above link), I learn some more details in a blog in SAP community:

How to Prepare for SAP‚Äôs New Certification‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäSAP Community

However, it‚Äôs still not very clear for me how it looks like in the actual exam. So I gave it a try. For the ‚ÄúSAP BTP Solution Architect‚Äù, it‚Äôs a ‚Äúscenario-based‚Äù exam format, where you need to play the role of a solution architect, designing the solution for a use case, then pitch the solution to AI avatar, or record a video and upload for expert review.

Unlike the previous exam format, where you need to setup some software (private browser) to take a prottor-monitored multiple-choice exam, in this new format, you will start directly from SAP learning website. This is the first look at the new exam format.

(To have this view, you must have purchased the SAP Certification Subcription; I will share in another post)

SAP Certificate landing page, where you can start the exam

After pressing on the ‚ÄúGo to Certification Exam‚Äù, the website will open a wizard like dialog to guide you through the process, which is quite user friendly:

SAP Certification Exam‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäScenario Based Assessment‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäAI Roleplay

For the exam of ‚ÄúSolution Architect‚Äù, you will be assigned to a use case, where you play the architect role to propose a solution to project stakeholders. The use case resembles the actual use case in one project.

For example, in my exam, I need to design a soluton for Field Service Maintainance Engineer to efficiently get and update data with S/4 systems, while they‚Äôre working at customer site.

After reading the use case, once you‚Äôre ready, you can choose 1 out of 2 options to proceed with the pitching part.

For the next step, you will have 2 options to join the xam:

  • AI Roleplay with AI Guidance.
  • Record Video with Human Review.

I tried both, and share my experience as below:

1. A Fresh Concept: Scenario-Based + AI Roleplay

The most exciting part of the new format is the ‚ÄúRoleplay with AI‚Äù feature. Instead of answering static questions, you interact with an AI avatar acting as your stakeholder, and you must propose and justify your architecture on SAP BTP.

This idea is brilliant‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit mimics real project work and tests your ability to think, design, and explain like a true architect.

However‚Ä¶ the reality wasn‚Äôt as smooth as expected.

2. Technical Issues: The AI Mode Was Not Stable

Despite an impressive concept, the AI roleplay mode repeatedly failed during my attempts. I tried everything:

  • Company laptop and personal MacBook
  • Corporate network, home Wi-Fi, mobile hotspot
  • Multiple browsers and system setups

Yet the final step always returned the same message:

‚ÄúAn error occurred. Please refresh the page and try again. If the issue persists, contact the support team for assistance.‚Äù

AI Roleplay option‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääerror

The other option with Human review also didn‚Äôt work:

Human review option‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääerror

Since SAP requires exam submission within 24 hours, the pressure was real. I opened a support ticket, but even after a full working day, there was no response.

3. The Backup Plan: Human Review

Fortunately, late in the day, one of my setups finally allowed me to switch to the ‚ÄúTraditional Assessment‚Äù option, with human review my recording. This required me to:

  • Record and upload a video explaining my architecture
  • Wait for a manual evaluation by an SAP expert

For this option, things are very ‚Äúgeneric‚Äù. SAP does not provides any details on the expectation of the video. All you can do is to prepare the best solution, and present it, during the 2 hours period.

After submitting your video, you will get the result immediately with the AI Roleplace approach. But with the human review approach, you will need to wait for a long time to get the result. During this period, if you enter the certification page again, you will get the ‚ÄúIn Review‚Äù status:

 

The downside?
 The waiting time for results is now 20 days.
 This delay is a huge gap in the expectation of exam taker in this fast-paced world.

4. Final Thoughts: Great Idea, but Needs Stability

I truly appreciate SAP‚Äôs direction. A scenario-based, open-book exam that simulates real project challenges is the right way forward. It evaluates real skills‚Ää‚Äî‚Äänot memorization.

But the instability of the AI mode currently holds back the full potential of this format. When candidates must fall back to manual review, the process becomes:

  • Slow
  • Costly
  • Frustrating
  • Uncertain

For exam takers, waiting nearly a month for results is a painful experience.

5. Looking Ahead

I hope SAP can quickly stabilize the AI roleplay feature. When it works, it will elevate the certification experience and set a new benchmark for professional exams.

The concept is powerful.
 The execution just needs more refinement.

And once it‚Äôs stable, I believe this format will truly redefine how SAP professionals prove their expertise in the future.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere ‚Äì The Cloud-Based Data Warehouse / Data Fabric Solution
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere plays a major role within SAP Business Data Cloud, our new data analytics platform.

 

SAP Datasphere is also a full-grown powerful data fabric / data warehouse solution on its own.

 

It provides graphical and pro-code options for data harmonization and integration. It is SAP‚Äôs strategic solution for this purpose.

 

 

You can even integrate native SAP HANA models (For details about these models, read Jan ZWICKEL‚Äôs blog about SAP HANA Calculation views).

In this community, you will find blogs and other resources on SAP Datasphere. As this is a highly dynamic topic with a new wave every 2 weeks, please check regularly for updates. Feel free to ask questions. Please feel free to use this new community and connect with us and other learners.

Your feedback on these resources is highly welcome. Also let us know about topics you would like to have covered in future live sessions and blogs, so that we can make our content even more suited to your needs.

So, how can you take up knowledge about SAP Datasphere and prove it?

 

Learning about SAP Datasphere

  • If you want to find a short overview, the 3 hour online course Exploring SAP Datasphere suits you best. Search for DSPE01 on https://learning.sap.com.
  • If you need information about the cloud-based SAP BW/4HANA tenant called SAP Datasphere, SAP BW bridge, we offer the 4 hour online course SAP Datasphere, SAP BW Bridge.

 

 

 

 What if you want to practice?

Here again, we have nice courses for you!

  • The SAP Datasphere Overview  (online tour offers a complementary system. (Search for TRIAL_INT_DSP_OVERVIEW on https://learning.sap.com.)

 

 

 

  • If you want to dive deeper and ask questions, book the instructor-led DSP01 - Introduction to SAP Datasphere | SAP Training. Create your own models in several hands-on exercises based on 3 typical scenarios: file upload for self-service, fuzzy data matching, data harmonization from 3 different sources. (Search for DSP01 on https://training.sap.com)

 

 

 

Live Sessions

In addition to courses and practice systems, the SAP Learning portal offers live sessions that are useful to go keep learning, ask questions, deepen your knowledge on specific topics. These sessions are delivered by subject-matter-experts (SMEs), either from SAP Training, SAP Partners or other experts at SAP such as Product Managers.

The sessions come under five categories:

  • Get Started
  • Expert Deep Dive
  • What's New
  • Get Certified
  • Stay Certified

Some of the live sessions are available for free, some require a subscription. This is visible in the example below:

SAP Datasphere Live Session catalog sample on SAP Learning 

For example, we offer topics on Graphical Modeling for SAP Analytics Cloud, Performance Optimization for Backend Modelling and SAC Stories.

 

Want to prove your knowledge and increase your value?

When you feel prepared enough, you should take the certification.

SAP Datasphere is part of the AI-based practice certification C_BDCBC.

 

Happy learning with SAP!
